intro: Rondeletia ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Rondeletia ligulata is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
